ai-tika-abh09t1:12_0: ignorance is a condition for choices. Name and form are a condition for consciousness. Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields. The six sense fields are conditions for contact. Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is a condition for craving. Craving is a condition for grasping. Grasping is a condition for continued existence. Continued existence is a condition for rebirth. Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, for grief, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
ai-tika-abh09t1:13_0: Mindfulness of the Analysis of mindfulness.
ai-tika-abh09t1:14_1: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body internally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-tika-abh09t1:15_0: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings internally ...
ai-tika-abh09t1:16_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind internally ...

ai-tika-abh09t1:17_1: mindfulness meditation, and the analysis of mindfulness.
ai-tika-abh09t1:19_1: It’s when a mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise.
ai-tika-abh09t1:20_0: If they generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen are given up, even for the time of a finger-snap ...
ai-tika-abh09t1:21_0: If they generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that skillful qualities arise, even for the time of a finger-snap ...
ai-tika-abh09t1:22_0: so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are completed by development.
ai-tika-abh09t1:24_1: immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-tika-abh09t1:24_2: the breaking of the bases of psychic power.

ai-tika-abh09t1:30_0: It’s when a mendicant lives restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken. They guard the sense doors and eat in moderation, eat in moderation, and are committed to wakefulness. They guard the sense doors, moderation in eating, and because they’ve undertaken the training rules.
ai-tika-abh09t1:31_0: They act with situational awareness when going out and coming back; when looking ahead and aside; when bending and extending the limbs; when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes; when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting; when urinating and defecating; when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, speaking, and keeping silent.
ai-tika-abh09t1:32_0: So they frequent a secluded lodging.
ai-tika-abh09t1:33_0: Gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut. He meditates with a mind rid of desire and ill will, cleansing the mind of dullness and drowsiness, calm, stiffness and torpor, their mind peaceful inside, cleansing the world. He meditates with a mind rid of ill will, cleansing the stain of dullness and drowsiness, calm, and doubt.
ai-tika-abh09t1:34_0: After giving up these five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom. When the noble ones are weak and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected. They enter and remain in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-tika-abh09t1:35_0: Going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space. ... going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness.”
ai-tika-abh09t1:37_1: Firstly, a monk meditates spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth.
ai-tika-abh09t1:37_2: In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of love to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

ai-tika-abh09t1:66_1: The Realized One possesses ten powers of a Realized One. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-tika-abh09t1:66_3: Firstly, the Realized One truly understands the possible as possible and the impossible as impossible. This is the power of the Realized One.
ai-tika-abh09t1:66_4: and the Realised One, having this strength, claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-tika-abh09t1:67_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the result of deeds undertaken in the past, future, and present in terms of causes and reasons.

ai-tika-abh09t1:97_0: Nine things rooted in strikes, nine roots, and nine roots.
ai-tika-abh09t1:99_0: Ten defilements, ten bases of defilements, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, or a hundred.
ai-tika-abh09t1:100_0: When one of these eighteen currents of craving has been performed, then the thirty-six positions of the Realms of Craving is seen; and when the Buddha has produced the thirty-six currents of craving, he has thoroughly seen the thirty-six kinds of craving in the past, future and present. There are cravings of craving for the future.
ai-tika-abh09t1:103_0: Are any the elements of the constituents observed? When many sense faculties are there? What is the basis of psychic power? How many kinds of feeling?
ai-tika-abh09t1:104_0: There are these fourteen elements: eighteen elements of the sense fields, four primary elements, four bases of psychic power, seven classes of feeling, seven perceptions, eighteen elements, and nine kinds of feeling.
ai-tika-abh09t1:106_0: The Book of the Analysis is finished.
